alert.note: Alert for Debeque to Silt Corridor (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 19 at 10:19AM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Garfield and south central Rio Blanco Counties through 1100 AM MDT... At 1019 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 22 miles northwest of De Beque, or 35 miles north of Grand Junction, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Garfield and south central Rio Blanco Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes.
